newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-SPAIN COACH CLEMENTE SET TO EXTEND CONTRACT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SPAIN COACH CLEMENTE SET TO EXTEND CONTRACT.

text.p: Spanish soccer coach Javier Clemente is expected to extend his contract with the national side until 2000, according to reports in the Spanish media on Thursday.
"I hope the players like the news. In other areas there will be a variety of opinions," said the notoriously controversial Clemente in the sports daily 'Marca' on Thursday.
The Spanish Football Federation on Thursday confirmed that the matter would be reviewed at a meeting on Friday, and that the formalities of the extension would then be finalised.
Clemente's side lost to Italy in the quarter-finals of the 1994 World Cup, but, penalty shoot-outs apart, have been unbeaten since.
Spain qualified without loss for Euro '96 and were only eliminated after losing to hosts England on penalties in the quarter-finals, a game many commentators felt they deserved to win.
Clemente's side are favourites to win their World Cup qualifying group after following up a 2-0 home win over chief rivals Yugoslavia with a 1-1 draw in Belgrade last week.
